txt.en: The herald has fallen silent, his breath coming in a few last ragged gasps as his life fades.
'I hear the baying of those accursed hounds, quickly, make ready!'

'You are correct... I hear the baying of the Dunlending hounds approaching even now.\n\n'It seems we were fools to trust these wild men to parley fairly, but so be it... let us show them the quality of our valour!'
Instance: Rohirrim Herald
'Beware, there are more upon us!'
You were unable to defend the Rohirrim herald
Blow the Horn of the Rohirrim
You blow the Horn of the Rohirrim
Defend the herald of the Rohirrim from his ambushers.
The Rohirrim have come to your aid
Overwhelming numbers of wild men are approaching. Summon the Rohirrim to your aid.
Hold out until reinforcements arrive.
With the battle over, the herald you strove to protect lies dying. You speak to him, hoping to bring his final words to his allies at the Ford of Isen.
Talk to the Rohirrim herald
Defend the Rohirrim herald
Blow the Horn of the Rohirrim
Defeat the Dunlending attackers
Talk to the Rohirrim herald
Having quickly moved to rescue a herald of the Rohirrim from a Dunlending ambush, you have arrived only in time to desperately fend off the attackers.
'Argh! Look out, an archer!'
'The injury is grave my friend...'
'I hear more of them coming - I fear we shall both fall here...'
'Wait... the horn I carry... I have not the strength left to sound it... but you may!'
'Sound the horn of Rohan... and pray my brethren hear it...'

'You are a fine [placeholder] to stand by me in my final hour.

'Take my horn to the Ford and let Grimbold know that I have fallen. Tell him I am sorry....'

The herald's voice trails off into laboured breathing as he closes his eyes in pain and exhaustion.

He does not speak again.
